sentences.en: Afterwards, retrospective fear of the responsibility would make her feel almost faint.
sentences.cn: 后来，回想起要负的责任她几乎会吓晕过去。

sentences.en: Does responsibility end at the fitting of car seats?
sentences.cn: 只负责安装好汽车座椅吗？

sentences.en: Ellsworth was a martyr to his sense of honour and responsibility.
sentences.cn: 埃尔斯沃思深为自己的荣誉感和责任感所累。

sentences.en: I have a particular responsibility to ensure I make the right decision.
sentences.cn: 我肩负特殊责任，必须确保自己作出的决定是正确的。

sentences.en: I was numbed by the enormity of the responsibility.
sentences.cn: 责任之大让我惊慌失措。

sentences.en: I wouldn't call it a burden; I call it a responsibility.
sentences.cn: 我不觉得这是负担；我觉得它是一种责任。

sentences.en: Kelly’s promotion means more money and more responsibility.
sentences.cn: 凯利获得提升，这意味着钱多了，责任也更大了。

sentences.en: Many parents simply abdicate all responsibility for their children.
sentences.cn: 许多父母对孩子简直是完全撒手不管。

sentences.en: My responsibilities include answering the phone and dealing with customer enquiries.
sentences.cn: 我的职责包括接听电话，处理客户查询。

sentences.en: None of these people will admit responsibility for their actions.
sentences.cn: 这些人都不会愿意为自己的行为负责。

sentences.en: Officials tussled over who had responsibility for the newly fashionable unemployment agenda.
sentences.cn: 众官员为谁负责最近备受关注的失业议题一事争得不可开交。

sentences.en: She had shared responsibility for her brother since girlhood.
sentences.cn: 她还是个小姑娘的时候就分担起照顾弟弟的责任。

sentences.en: She would have loved to have a better-paying job with more responsibility.
sentences.cn: 她本想有一份报酬更高、职权更大的工作。

sentences.en: Some preteens are able to handle a good deal of responsibility.
sentences.cn: 有些青春期前的儿童能够承担很多责任。

sentences.en: The company cannot accept responsibility for loss or damage.
sentences.cn: 公司不承担丢失或损坏的责任。

sentences.en: We have made a conscious effort to devolve responsibility.
sentences.cn: 我们已有意识地下放职责。

sentences.en: We must be clear about where the responsibility lies.
sentences.cn: 我们必须清楚责任所在。

words.tran_cn: 负责的，可靠的；有责任的
回答；作出反应；承担责任

phrases.tran_cn: 自作主张地；未经授权地
责任会计；权责单位会计制

trans.tran_en: a duty to be in charge of someone or something, so that you make decisions and can be blamed if something bad happens
